Name: Amazonas
Description: Located in the northern part of Peru, known for its vast rainforests, biodiversity, and indigenous cultures.

Name: Áncash
Description: Located in the western highlands, famous for its mountain ranges, including the Huascarán National Park.

Name: Apurímac
Description: A mountainous region located in the southern Andes, known for its agriculture and traditional communities.

Name: Arequipa
Description: Known for its beautiful colonial architecture, volcanoes, and the Colca Canyon, one of the deepest in the world.

Name: Ayacucho
Description: A region rich in history, known for its role in Peru s  independence and its beautiful Andean landscapes.

Name: Cajamarca
Description: Located in the northern Andes, known for its mining industry, colonial architecture, and the famous Inca ruins of Cajamarca.

Name: Callao
Description: A coastal region that includes the major port city of Callao, serving as the main port for Lima.

Name: Cusco
Description: Known for being the historical capital of the Inca Empire and the gateway to the famous Machu Picchu.

Name: Huancavelica
Description: A mountainous region known for its mineral resources and agricultural production.

Name: Huanuco
Description: A diverse region that includes mountainous terrain and the central jungle, known for agriculture and tropical fruits.

Name: Ica
Description: A region famous for its desert landscapes, wineries, and the Nazca Lines, an ancient archaeological site.

Name: Junín
Description: A central region known for its lakes, mountains, and agricultural production, including coffee and dairy products.

Name: La Libertad
Description: A coastal region known for its beaches, historic ruins, and a key hub for agriculture, including sugar and rice.

Name: Lambayeque
Description: Known for its rich archaeological heritage, including the Moche and Sican cultures, as well as its agricultural production.

Name: Lima
Description: The capital region of Peru, which includes Lima, the country s largest city and a cultural, political, and economic center.

Name: Loreto
Description: Located in the Amazon rainforest, Loreto is known for its biodiversity and the mighty Amazon River.

Name: Madre de Dios
Description: A region rich in natural resources, especially in terms of its rainforest ecosystems and gold mining.

Name: Moquegua
Description: Known for its mining industry, especially copper, and its production of fruits like olives and grapes.

Name: Pasco
Description: A region located in the central Andes, known for its mountainous terrain, agriculture, and mining industries.

Name: Piura
Description: A coastal region known for its beaches, agriculture (especially mangoes), and its proximity to Ecuador.

Name: Puno
Description: Famous for the high-altitude Lake Titicaca, Puno is known for its indigenous cultures and agriculture.

Name: San Martín
Description: Located in the Amazon Basin, known for its agricultural products, especially coffee and cocoa.

Name: Tacna
Description: A border region known for its mining industry, especially copper and gold, and its historical significance during the War of the Pacific.

Name: Tumbes
Description: A coastal region in the north of Peru, known for its beaches, mangroves, and tropical ecosystems.

Name: Ucayali
Description: An Amazonian region known for its rivers, forests, and agricultural activities, especially the cultivation of palm oil.
